Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Content-Security-Policy has unrecognized directive" (#5790) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
In latest Chrome web tools console on page load:

```
Unrecognized Content-Security-Policy directive 'frame-ancestor'.
```

Current header value:
```
Content-Security-Policy: frame-ancestor 'none'
```

I think this should be **frame-ancestors** (plural).

Opened issue ""Organizations" should not be plural when there is only 1" (#5789) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
When logged in as a user that is a member of an organization, go to the profile page.

For example, for me on DEV environment:
https://dev.nugettest.org/profiles/jver

![2f200963](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/94054/38576859-28cf9dda-3cb4-11e8-8542-fe7802af4478.PNG)

Two things:

1. "1 organizations" should be "1 organization"
1. The link should not include the space before the number. Right now there is a dangling underline on the link.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[ReleasePrep][2018.04.05]RI of dev into master" (#5788) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Closed issue "catalog2dnx no-op can miss index.json update" (#5473) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
The no-op in catalog2dnx has the following rule.

If the source .nupkg and destination .nupkg have the same `Content-MD5` header, skip the catalog leaf.

Also, if the no-op does not pass and catalog2dnx determines the package should be added, it performs the following steps in sequence:

1. Upload .nuspec
1. Upload .nupkg
1. Update index.json

Suppose the update of the index.json fails. The next time catalog2dnx attempts to add the package, the no-op will occur and the index.json will never be updated.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Enforce RepositorySignatureInformation on Repository countersignatures" (#6807) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: Currently when we check the `RepositorySignatureInformation` on a signature it is only aware of primary signatures. The `AllowListVerificationProvider` needs to be updated to take into account different signature placements apart from signature targets.

1. dotnet new library

This succeeds

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Pack doesn't give enough info on invalid version strings" (#6806) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
When pack encounters an empty version string in a dependency node it should include the line number in the error message. Today it only says 

```
>  error : '' is not a valid version string. 
```

That is fine for small nuspec. But when your nuspec has 20+ entries where every single version is a replacement string then it's a bit madenning to track down which one has a typo in your build script. 

Example of a problem nuspec file:

``` xml
<dependencies>
  <group targetFramework="netstandard1.3">
    <dependency id="Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Analyzers"              version="$MicrosoftCodeAnalysisAnalyzersVersion$" />

    <dependency id="System.AppContext"                             version="$SystemAppContextVersion$"/>
    <dependency id="System.Collections"                            version="$SystemCollectionsVersion$"/>
    <dependency id="System.Collections.Concurrent"                 version="$SystemCollectionsConcurrentVersion$"/>
    <dependency id="System.Collections.Immutable"                  version="$SystemCollectionsImmutableVersion$"/>
    <dependency id="System.Console"                                version="$SystemConsoleVersion$"/>
    <dependency id="System.Diagnostics.Debug"                      version="$SystemDiagnosticsDebugVersion$"/>
    <dependency id="System.Diagnostics.FileVersionInfo"            version="$SystemDiagnosticsFileVersionInfoVersion$" exclude="Compile" />
    <dependency id="System.Diagnostics.StackTrace"                 version="$SystemDiagnosticsStackTraceVersion$" exclude="Compile" />
    <dependency id="System.Diagnostics.Tools"                      version="$SystemDiagnosticsToolsVersion$"/>
    <dependency id="System.Dynamic.Runtime"                        version="$SystemDynamicRuntimeVersion$"/>
    <dependency id="System.Globalization"                          version="$SystemGlobalizationVersion$"/>
    <dependency id="System.IO.Compression"                         version="$SystemIOCompressionVersion$" />
    <dependency id="System.IO.FileSystem"                          version="$SystemIOFileSystemVersion$"/>
    <dependency id="System.IO.FileSystem.Primitives"               version="$SystemIOFileSystemPrimitivesVersion$"/>
    <dependency id="System.Linq"                                   version="$SystemLinqVersion$"/>
    <dependency id="System.Linq.Expressions"                       version="$SystemLinqExpressionsVersion$"/>
    <dependency id="System.Reflection"                             version="$SystemReflectionVersion$"/>
    <dependency id="System.Reflection.Metadata"                    version="$SystemReflectionMetadataVersion$"/>
    <dependency id="System.Resources.ResourceManager"              version="$SystemResourcesResourceManagerVersion$"/>
    <dependency id="System.Runtime"                                version="$SystemRuntimeVersion$"/>
    <dependency id="System.Runtime.Extensions"                     version="$SystemRuntimeExtensionsVersion$"/>
    <dependency id="System.Runtime.InteropServices"                version="$SystemRuntimeInteropServicesVersion$"/>
    <dependency id="System.Runtime.Numerics"                       version="$SystemRuntimeNumericsVersion$"/>
    <dependency id="System.Security.Cryptography.Algorithms"       version="$SystemSecurityCryptographyAlgorithmsVersion$"/>
    <dependency id="System.Security.Cryptography.Encoding"         version="$SystemSecurityCryptographyEncodingVersion$"/>
    <dependency id="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates" version="$SystemSecurityCryptographyX509CertificatesVersion$"/>
    <dependency id="System.Text.Encoding"                          version="$SystemTextEncodingVersion$"/>
    <dependency id="System.Text.Encoding.CodePages"                version="$SystemTextEncodingCodePagesVersion$" exclude="Compile" />
    <dependency id="System.Text.Encoding.Extensions"               version="$SystemTextEncodingExtensionsVersion$"/>
    <dependency id="System.Threading"                              version="$SystemThreadingVersion$" exclude="Compile" />
    <dependency id="System.Threading.Tasks"                        version="$SystemThreadingTasksVersion$"/>
    <dependency id="System.Threading.Tasks.Parallel"               version="$SystemThreadingTasksParallelVersion$"/>
    <dependency id="System.Threading.Thread"                       version="$SystemThreadingThreadVersion$" exclude="Compile" />
    <dependency id="System.ValueTuple"                             version="$SystemValueTupleVersion$" />
    <dependency id="System.Xml.ReaderWriter"                       version="$SystemXmlReaderWriterVersion$"/>
    <dependency id="System.Xml.XDocument"                          version="$SystemXmlXDocumentVersion$"/>
    <dependency id="System.Xml.XmlDocument"                        version="$SystemXmlXmlDocumentVersion$" exclude="Compile" />
    <dependency id="System.Xml.XPath.XDocument"                    version="$SystemXmlXPathXDocumentVersion$" exclude="Compile" />
  </group>
</dependencies>

```

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Package is not found in the following primary source(s). Please Verify your online package sources..." (#6804) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

**NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | VS UI | Package Manager Console | dotnet.exe):**

VS UI

**NuGet version (x.x.x.xxx):**

NuGet version 4.6.0

**dotnet.exe --version (if appropriate):**

**VS version (if appropriate):**

Visual Studio 2017 15.6.6

**OS version (i.e. win10 v1607 (14393.321)):**

Windows 7 Professional. Service pack 1

**Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version:**

It worked before with Visual Studio 2013. Version 12.0.40629.00 Update 5
VS UI: Version 2.12.0.817

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1. Using NuGet Package Explorer, I create a new NuGet package that has just a content folder and one .cs file in it. There are no dependencies for this NuGet package.

2. After setting the name and ID within NuGet Package Explorer, I've saved it to a local folder for testing.
Values for the ID and Version:
ID: TestPackage.TestName
Version: 1.0.0-alpha 

3. I open VS 2017 and fire up a brand new empty web application with the "MVC" checkbox checked.

4. I right click the project -> manage NuGet packages -> pick my local source (C:\LocalNuGets\PreReleases) -> Install on my only project.

5. Error received:
Package 'TestPackage.TestName 1.0.0-alpha' is not found in the following primary source(s): 'C:\LocalNuGets\PreReleases'. Please verify all your online package sources are available (OR) package id, version are specified correctly.



...

## Other suggested things
**dotnet --info**

.NET Command Line Tools (2.1.104)

**Product Information:**
 Version:            2.1.104

**Runtime Environment:**
 OS Name:     Windows
 OS Version:  6.1.7601
 OS Platform: Windows
 RID:         win7-x64

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Deprecation of www.nuget.org/nuget.exe" (#20) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
|Spec wiki|Discussion issue|
|----------|------------------|
|*None*|https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/5381|

We are deprecating the use of URL: **www.nuget.org/nuget.exe** which currently downloads nuget.exe version 2.8.6. If you have a dependency on this URL, we recommend you to start using **https://dist.nuget.org/win-x86-commandline/v2.8.6/nuget.exe**. 

For consistency, we are also changing this endpoint to redirect to dist.nuget.org, which is our primary home for downloading all released versions of nuget.exe. 

**Old redirect:** https://az320820.vo.msecnd.net/downloads/nuget.exe 
**New redirect:** https://dist.nuget.org/win-x86-commandline/v2.8.6/nuget.exe

If you are interested in downloading newer versions of nuget.exe, please see the [Downloads](https://www.nuget.org/downloads) page on nuget.org.

For other methods of installing our client tools, please see our [Installing NuGet client tool](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/install-nuget-client-tools) documentation.

**Note:** There is no immediate plan to remove the URL **www.nuget.org/nuget.exe** . We will monitor the usage before taking it offline. We will also reach out again before taking the URL offline.
